question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate, professional responses. Be sure to ensure that the generated code is executable for demonstration. How to use Tencent Cloud components to develop a technical operations management application/WeChat mini program that includes: 1. Daily inspections: inspection personnel upload inspection images, fill in inspection notes, and submit to reviewers for approval; 2. Operations support: operations staff report daily maintenance activities and submit to reviewers for approval; 3. Report queries: reviewers can check inspection and operations situations, including frequency and content.

checklist.title: Is the daily inspection module fully implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code accurately implements the daily inspection workflow, including image upload, note entry, and approval mechanisms using Tencent Cloud components. Check if the code implements TCB (Tencent CloudBase) for data storage, image compression and storage in COS (Cloud Object Storage), and secure user authentication. Score 0 if the core functionality is missing, 5 if basic functionality is implemented but lacking cloud integration, and 10 if fully implemented with proper Tencent Cloud services.

checklist.title: Is the operations support module correctly implemented?
checklist.description: Review the implementation of the operations support system, including daily maintenance activity reporting and the approval workflow. Verify that it uses Tencent Cloud Serverless functions for backend logic and proper database schema design for maintenance records. The implementation should include status tracking and notifications. Deduct 5 points if the approval workflow is incomplete, 3 points if notification mechanisms are missing. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the report query system properly designed?
checklist.description: Assess whether the reporting system enables reviewers to effectively query and analyze both inspection and operations data. Check if it implements Tencent Cloud's data visualization components, supports filtering by date ranges, personnel, and status. Verify if it includes statistical analysis functions and exportable reports. Deduct 5 points if filtering capabilities are limited, 3 points if visualization is inadequate, and 5 points if export functionality is missing. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the WeChat Mini Program integration properly implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate the WeChat Mini Program implementation, focusing on integration with Tencent Cloud services and WeChat's native capabilities. Check for proper use of WeChat login, cloud functions connection, offline data caching, and push notification integration. The code should follow WeChat Mini Program development best practices. Deduct 5 points for improper authentication flow, 3 points for missing offline capabilities, and 5 points for security vulnerabilities in cloud API calls. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as network interruption, image upload failures, form validation errors, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. AI-powered image analysis for inspection verification 2. Automated report generation with insights 3. Location-based task assignment). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple approval workflows coexisting) 2. Function modules unrelated to operations management (e.g., a built-in game feature) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., unnecessary animations on critical paths). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating business logic/view/network layers), unit test coverage, and build process automation. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the build process is not automated. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Click feedback delay ≤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for visual after-images during fast sliding, and 5 points for hard-to-find key function buttons. The full score is 10 points.
